comments:
Build: I20060427-0010

I synchronized my entire workspace against HEAD.  The following error was reported while synchronizing the org.eclipse.test project.  The project had no outgoing changes.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 2006-04-28 12:02:17.156
!MESSAGE Problems reported while synchronizing CVS Workspace. 80 of 81 resources were synchronized.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.team.core 4 0 2006-04-28 12:02:17.171
!MESSAGE An error occurred synchronizing /org.eclipse.test: The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
!STACK 1
org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSException: The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.UpdateContentCachingService.cacheFileContents(UpdateContentCachingService.java:191)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.UpdateContentCachingService.buildRemoteTree(UpdateContentCachingService.java:105)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.resources.CVSWorkspaceRoot.getRemoteTree(CVSWorkspaceRoot.java:176)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.fetchVariant(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:85)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.syncinfo.CVSResourceVariantTree.refresh(CVSResourceVariantTree.java:330)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.AbstractResourceVariantTree.refresh(AbstractResourceVariantTree.java:55)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:162)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.variants.ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.refresh(ResourceVariantTreeSubscriber.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.subscribers.Subscriber.refresh(Subscriber.java:459)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.CVSWorkspaceSubscriber.refreshWithContentFetch(CVSWorkspaceSubscriber.java:434)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.mappings.WorkspaceSubscriberContext.refresh(WorkspaceSubscriberContext.java:310)
	at org.eclipse.team.core.mapping.provider.SynchronizationContext.refresh(SynchronizationContext.java:109)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.RefreshModelParticipantJob.doRefresh(RefreshModelParticipantJob.java:66)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.RefreshParticipantJob.run(RefreshParticipantJob.java:308)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ui.synchronize.RefreshModelParticipantJob.run(RefreshModelParticipantJob.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
!SUBENTRY 2 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 1 2006-04-28 12:02:17.562
!MESSAGE The following warnings were reported while performing the "cvs update" command.
!SUBENTRY 3 org.eclipse.team.cvs.core 4 -14 2006-04-28 12:02:17.562
!MESSAGE org.eclipse.test: cvs update: cannot open directory /cvsroot/eclipse/org.eclipse.test/META-INF: No such file or directory

This error is caused by an empty folder that used to exist on the server but was removed. However, Eclipse keeps track of empty directories as a performance optimization during synchronization. I believe we will need a fix for this for 3.2.

Created an attachment (id=39831)
Potential fix (still needs to be tested)

Created an attachment (id=40047)
Latest patch after some testing reveal a problem
*** Bug 139892 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

I'm using eclipse 3.2RC7 on Macintosh and I still have this problem.

Actually this is more my problem:

https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=139892

But that bug report has been marked as a duplicate of this.

You may also read this bug report (at first I thought there was a problem with the repository):

https://sourceforge.net/tracker/?func=detail&aid=1490739&group_id=1&atid=200001
Anders, I would suggest reopening bug 139892 or entering a new one. Bug 139892 was mark a duplicate because the reported was not providing any more information and it looked simialr to this one.
